required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MR-guided LITT Therapy in Patients With Primary Irresectable Glioblastoma
clinical_study.official_title: MR-guided LITT Therapy in Patients With Primary Irresectable Glioblastoma: a Randomized Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Objective: In preparation of a randomized controlled trial, the investigators aim to assess pilot data on technical feasibility and safety of laser interstitial thermal therapy (LITT) at Radboud University Medical centre and to assess practical feasibility of a randomized study in patients with primary irresectable glioblastoma, as compared with standard of care.
Study design: Prospective randomized pilot study. Randomization stopped (amendment September 2nd, 2021),
Study population: 20 patients aged >= 18 with radiologically suspected diagnosis of primary glioblastoma and contra-indication for surgical resection.
Intervention: Patients will be randomized to receive either (i) biopsy and LITT (n=10) or (ii) biopsy alone (n=10).

primary_outcome.measure: Inclusion rate of patients meeting the inclusion criteria
primary_outcome.description: To assess practical feasibility of a randomized study in this patient population, in preparation of a future randomized controlled trial
To assess practical feasibility of a randomized study in this patient population, in preparation of a future randomized controlled trial

primary_outcome.description: To assess practical feasibility of a randomized study in this patient population, in preparation of a future randomized controlled trial
To assess safety of LITT at our center in patients with irresectable glioblastoma
To assess safety of LITT at our center in patients with irresectable glioblastoma
To assess feasibility of LITT at our center in patients with irresectable glioblastoma

primary_outcome.measure: Time from LITT to adjuvant therapy
primary_outcome.description: To assess feasibility of LITT at our center in patients with irresectable glioblastoma

primary_outcome.measure: Ablation of 90 percent of the target lesion in at least 70 percent of patients
primary_outcome.description: To assess feasibility of LITT at our center in patients with irresectable glioblastoma

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall survival and progression free survival
secondary_outcome.description: To assess preliminary data on survival

secondary_outcome.measure: Euro quality of life-5D (from 11111, best outcome to 55555 worse outcome)
secondary_outcome.description: To assess preliminary data on quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer - BN20 brain module
secondary_outcome.description: To assess preliminary data on quality of life
To assess tumour volume evolution on MRI at 3 months post-operatively

arm_group.description: Patients will be randomized to receive biopsy and LITT (n=10)

intervention.description: The Visualase Thermal Therapy System is used to necrotize or coagulate soft tissue through interstitial irradiation under MRI guidance

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
In order to be eligible to participate in the study, a patient must meet all of the following criteria:
- Informed consent, age >18-year-old
- Supratentorial localization
- Maximal volume <=70cc on post-contrast T1 MRI
- Safe trajectory/trajectories possible for ablation of 70% of the tumour, avoiding eloquent structures or transgression of a ventricle or vessel .
- Karnofsky Performance Status (KPS) >= 70
Exclusion criteria
A potential subject who meets any of the following criteria will be excluded from participation in this study:
- Contra-indication for general anaesthesia or MRI
- Lesion >70cc on post-contrast MRI on the day before intervention.
- Non-glioblastoma diagnosis as per frozen section analysis
- Pregnancy
